U2's collaboration with BB King on the song "When Love Comes to Town" from their album Rattle and Hum was significant in that it introduced blues elements into U2's sound. The song features a blues-inspired guitar riff from the Edge and some soulful vocals from Bono, as well as a guest appearance from King himself. King's unmistakable guitar style and blues sensibilities helped to ground the song in the roots of American music, while also giving U2 the opportunity to experiment with a different genre.

Kendrick Lamar's collaboration with U2 on the song "XXX" from his Pulitzer-winning 2017 album DAMN was also an important moment for the band.  The song featured a chilling verse from Bono, as well as a surrealist beat from producer Mike WiLL Made-It. The collaboration saw U2 step outside of their comfort zone, embracing hip-hop and experimental styles in a way that they had not done before. The song was praised for its combination of U2's classic rock sound with Kendrick's socially conscious rap lyrics, which created a unique and powerful musical statement.

Both collaborations helped to show how U2 were willing to explore new musical styles and themes throughout their career, while still retaining their signature sound and passion. U2's collaborations with BB King and Kendrick Lamar allowed them to explore new musical genres and styles, while also giving them the opportunity to work with two legendary artists from vastly different worlds.
